results.snippet: Queen Frederika, the self-exiled mother of King Constantine of Greece, is no longer in trouble with the Holy Synod of the Greek Orthodox Church. The synod has dropped charges, brought against her by Bishop Avgoustinos, Metropolitan of Florina, that...
results.lead_paragraph: Queen Frederika, the self-exiled mother of King Constantine of Greece, is no longer in trouble with the Holy Synod of the Greek Orthodox Church. The synod has dropped charges, brought against her by Bishop Avgoustinos, Metropolitan of Florina, that her autobiography contained anti-Christian doctrines and ideas against Orthodoxy.

headline.main: TV: Ballet From China; Dance Seen by Nixon Is Splendid Show -- Vonnegut Program on Tonight

results.snippet: There it was yesterday afternoon right on the capitalistic homescreen: the "first spectacular from China." Over at the National Broadcasting Company, producer Lucy Jarvis had the clever sense, plus the cooperation of the United Nations delegation...
results.lead_paragraph: There it was yesterday afternoon right on the capitalistic homescreen: the "first spectacular from China." Over at the National Broadcasting Company, producer Lucy Jarvis had the clever sense, plus the cooperation of the United Nations delegation from China, to obtain rights to the filmed version of the Peking Opera's "Red Detachment of Women."

headline.main: Power Is Said to Be Strong Enough to Last 20 Years; A Long-Lived Pacer for Hearts Among Patents Issued in Week

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, March 17 -- A long-lived heart pacer with a radioactive power source has been invented for the Atomic Energy Commission and the National Heart and Lung Institute. David L. Purdy, an electromechanical cal engineer, was granted Patent...

byline.original: By STACY V. JONESSpecial to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, March 17 -- A long-lived heart pacer with a radioactive power source has been invented for the Atomic Energy Commission and the National Heart and Lung Institute. David L. Purdy, an electromechanical cal engineer, was granted Patent 3,649,367 this week.

headline.main: TV: Channel 9 Pays Earth Day a 12-Hour Tribute

results.snippet: Yesterday was International Earth Day and, while the event got a respectable share of passing notice, WOR-TV, Channel 9, made the staggering most of it. In cooperation with the United Nations, the station presented a 12-hour ecology marathon called...
results.lead_paragraph: Yesterday was International Earth Day and, while the event got a respectable share of passing notice, WOR-TV, Channel 9, made the staggering most of it. In cooperation with the United Nations, the station presented a 12-hour ecology marathon called "E-Day '72."

headline.main: Soviet Space Center: Hope Amid Expansion; Soviet Space Center: Hope Pervades an Expanding Facility

results.snippet: ZVEZDNY GORODOK, U.S.S.R., March 19--A visit to the place where the Russian astronauts live and train produces the clear impression that the Soviet Union is actively and optimistically expanding its space program.

results.lead_paragraph: ZVEZDNY GORODOK, U.S.S.R., March 19--A visit to the place where the Russian astronauts live and train produces the clear impression that the Soviet Union is actively and optimistically expanding its space program.

results.abstract: ed contends Wilford visit to Star City, USSR space center, indicates USSR seeks greater space cooperation with US; suggests joint lunar exploration; holds such missions could help alleviate pol and ideological animosities on earth; notes speculation that USSR Communist party chief Brezhnev may offer concrete space cooperation proposals during May summit meeting with Pres Nixon, Moscow; asserts such an initiative could open way for fuller exploration of moon, a worthwhile scientific goal, without distortions of natl econ priorities entailed by continued space rivalry

results.abstract: Internatl Auto Show opens, NY Coliseum; show features latest car models, experimental safety vehicles and special elec and rotary engine cars; exhibits described; illus

headline.main: Auto Show, With Something for All, Opens Saturday

results.snippet: Cars of all kinds -- sleek luxury vehicles that only a millionaire could afford, crazy contraptions that only an eccentric could want and a "moon car" from the space program that only an astronaut could drive and standard models -- will go on display...
results.lead_paragraph: Cars of all kinds -- sleek luxury vehicles that only a millionaire could afford, crazy contraptions that only an eccentric could want and a "moon car" from the space program that only an astronaut could drive and standard models -- will go on display Saturday when the International 16th Automobile Show opens its nine-day run at the New York Coliseum.
